content: com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe using smaller circular needle #5 knit one row being careful not to twist stitches place marker for beginning of row bor and then join to knit in the round next row begin ribbing pattern using *k2 p1* around for 3 75 -4 joining folded brim place the 96 provisionally cast on sts onto another circular needle fold right side out align the two needles and then knit the two paired stitches together from both of the two needles together repeat all the way around to create the folded brim that is knitted together main body change to #8 circular needle and knit 1 row around while simultaneously increasing by 12 sts evenly around using a kf/b on every 8th st 108 sts this is a relaxed knit knit it too tight and corn row will appear plus it will be a smaller fit attach cc yarn and start checkerboard pattern i recommend you switch the yarns in a row using an over under technique as that will minimize tangling to do this always bring the mc yarn forward on top over the cc yarn and bring the cc color forward from below under the mc yarn row 1 & 2 *k2 mc k2 cc* repeat around 27 times to bor slip bor row 3 & 4 *k2 cc k2 mc* repeat around 27 times to bor slip bor repeat these 4 row until hat measures 6 or desired length from brim edge ending with a row 2 for me this worked out to 18 pattern row or nine 2-row stripes finishing with a row 2 now proceed to crown decrease all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit crown decrease this decrease is more difficult to describe than knit however if followed carefully the reward is great as it will produce an almost seamless appearing decrease with no apparent break in the checkerboard pattern after a few row you should get the hang of it be sure the last row you completed on the body is row 2 in the checkerboard pattern there should be two mc sts on the left-hand needle after the bor using markers in a different color than the bor divide the 108 sts on the needle into 6 groups of 18 sts and place markers you will note that where the markers start in the pattern will vary some sections will start with 2 mc st and some alternately 2 cc st when you need to switch from circular 2 dpn needles be sure the breaks between the needles fall at a point where a marker would have been this gap between needles substitutes for a marker in the directions below decrease row 1 note that the previous row ended with a row 2 so this row will be a row 3 and will start a color change *2 cc 2 mc* etc
